section.p: Each section can have subsections in its body to split things into groups.

category.title: Category title
category.p:
'category' is not a 'sub-sub-sub-section' for a few reasons:
It's a bit of a mouthful
It is used in the PRM to break up blocks of text into alternative topics (rather than to introduce new topics which is what the subsections do)
It is horizontally aligned with the body text, which reinforces its use in not breaking into new topics, which the outdented sections do. (Presentational details may change in future presentations of these documents).

section.title: Overview
section.p: An overview of how the component is viewed by the outside world; what it does and the manner in which it does it.
Sometimes the Introduction and the Overview are joined to make 'Introduction and Overview'.

section.title: Terminology
section.p: Any terminology specific to this chapter which is assumed knowledge for readers. Most components do not require the terms to be defined.

section.title: Technical details
section.p: Technical details about how to operate the component; this is usually the largest section and fleshes out the summaries described above and in the following sections with the 'whys', the 'hows' and the specifics on the usage. Usually this section includes some of the details about data structures.

section.title: VDU codes
section.p: Lists the VDU codes, using vdu-definition, which are provided by this component. This is a specialised section unlikely to be needed by most components.

vdu-definition.parameter: to send to the printer stream

use.p: VDU 1 sends the next character to the printer stream only, provided that the printer has been enabled by VDU 2. Otherwise, the next character is ignored. This enables the printer ignore character, and any other character which is not usually passed on by the VDU printer driver, to be sent to the printer through the VDU.

example.p:
VDU 1,10
Send a linefeed to the printer stream, if enabled
